TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata

Docs.summary: Enables in-place updates to existing blocks of .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata> is not associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> that is obtained through a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder>, the attempt to write metadata by using the in-place writer will fail. Successful write operations apply the metadata directly to the image stream by means of a decoder.
In-place metadata updates fail if an attempt is made to write metadata that a given bitmap format does not support.
To perform in-place metadata edits, the bitmap must be decoded using either the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache options. <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> does not guarantee access to the metadata stream needed for in-place metadata edits.
## Examples This example shows how you can modify metadata within an image without having to re-encode the image. The following example uses an InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter to write metadata into an image.
[!code-cpp[BitmapMetadata#SetQuery](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/bitmapmetadata/BitmapMetadata.cpp#setquery)] [!code-cs[BitmapMetadata#SetQuery](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/BitmapMetadata/BitmapMetadata.cs#setquery)] [!code-vb[BitmapMetadata#SetQuery](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/BitmapMetadata/BitmapMetadata.vb#setquery)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

.method public hidebysig instance bool TrySave() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether image metadata can be saved successfully.
Docs.returns: if bitmap metadata can be written successfully; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the TrySave method to determine whether metadata can be written successfully to a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] image.
[!code-cpp[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/bitmapmetadata/BitmapMetadata.cpp#setquery)] [!code-cs[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/BitmapMetadata/BitmapMetadata.cs#setquery)] [!code-vb[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/BitmapMetadata/BitmapMetadata.vb#setquery)]
